p: Ebola caught the attention of the global press and resulted in a massive mobilization, including support from the international communi ty. It is not demographically significant, however, because the numbers of casualties are too small. Nonetheless, it has been extremely costly. A WHO document estimated that the sum of US$1536 million was needed to stop the outbreak, treat infected people, ensure essential services, preserve stability, and prevent outbreaks in countries as yet unaffected (WHO 2015a). As of May 2015, only US$482 million had been mobilized.
